io.smudgr.util

Class PixelFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.smudgr.util.Frame
      • io.smudgr.util.PixelFrame

  • public class PixelFrame
extends Frame
    Instances of the PixelFrame class are used to store the pixel data of an image.

    The DisposedFrameProvider allows PixelFrame instances to reuse memory efficiently and avoid unnecessary string on the JVM garbage collector.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int[] pixels
      Direct access array of the ARGB color integers backing this PixelFrame

      • pixels

        public int[] pixels
        Direct access array of the ARGB color integers backing this PixelFrame

    • Constructor Detail

      • PixelFrame

        public PixelFrame(int w,
                  int h)
        Create a new PixelFrame with the given dimensions, without clearing the backing memory.

        The new PixelFrame may contain disposed pixel data. If this is a problem, use PixelFrame(BufferedImage) instead.

        Parameters:
        w - width
        h - height

      • PixelFrame

        public PixelFrame(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Create a new PixelFrame from the given BufferedImage
        Parameters:
        image - BufferedImage

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public PixelFrame copy()
        Creates a duplicate of this PixelFrame, using new memory space (or disposed memory if disposed frames of this size exist)
        Specified by:
        copy in class Frame
        Returns:
        duplicate PixelFrame

      • copyTo

        public void copyTo(PixelFrame f)
        Copy this PixelFrame to the given PixelFrame, copying only until this PixelFrame length is reached, or the given PixelFrame length is reached.
        Parameters:
        f - PixelFrame of equal dimensions (ideally)

      • drawTo

        public void drawTo(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Draw this frame to the given BufferedImage

        This is especially useful for flushing pixels to screen if the given BufferedImage is backed by native screen space.

        Parameters:
        image - BufferedImage

      • fitToSize

        public PixelFrame fitToSize(int toSizeW,
                            int toSizeH)
        Without changing dimension ratios, fit this PixelFrame to the given size and fill blank space with black.
        Parameters:
        toSizeW - new width
        toSizeH - new height
        Returns:
        fitted PixelFrame

      • fitToSize

        public PixelFrame fitToSize(int toSizeW,
                            int toSizeH,
                            boolean fill)
        Without changing dimension ratios, return a copy of this PixelFrame fitted to the given size, optionally filling blank space with black.
        Parameters:
        toSizeW - new width
        toSizeH - new height
        fill - If true, to return a frame of exactly toSizeW x toSizeH with blank space filled with black. Otherwise, a frame with scaled dimensions of the original ratio is returned.
        Returns:
        fitted PixelFrame

      • generateThumbnail

        public PixelFrame generateThumbnail()
        Generates a small preview of this frame with a maximum size of 200x200
        Returns:
        PixelFrame thumbnail

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        new PixelFrame
